thig6.4:1.2: bestrewn with sandalwood and flower garlands,
thig6.4:1.3: I was completely covered with ornaments,
thig6.4:1.4: attended to by a following of servants.
thig6.4:2.2: with a substantial quantity of staples and delicacies,
thig6.4:3.1: I enjoyed and amused myself there,
thig6.4:3.2: and went back to my own house.
thig6.4:3.3: In order to see a monastic dwelling,
thig6.4:3.4: I went into Sāketa's Añjana forest.
thig6.4:4.1: I saw the Buddha, the lamp of the world,
thig6.4:4.2: and I sat down after paying respect.
thig6.4:4.3: The one who knows, he taught me the Dhamma
thig6.4:5.3: There I touched the stainless Dhamma,
thig6.4:6.1: Then, as I learned the true Dhamma,
thig6.4:6.3: Obtained are the three higher knowledges,
thig6.4:6.4: the teaching of the Buddha was not in vain."
